discrepancies.recommendation: Add to CSV with Type=Script, Server=coderef-core, Category=Setup, Description='Creates .coderef/ directory structure with Phase 0 initialization'
Add to CSV with Type=Script, Server=coderef-core, Category=Testing, Description='Unit tests for setup_coderef_dirs.py with 100% test coverage'
Add to CSV with Type=Script, Server=coderef-core, Category=Scanners, Description='CLI scanner implementation for CodeRef analysis (CommonJS)'

new_resources.name: setup_coderef_dirs.py
new_resources.description: Creates .coderef/ directory structure with Phase 0 initialization (directories, schemas, templates)
new_resources.notes: Phase 0 of scanner workflow. Creates 8 directories (.coderef/reports, .coderef/diagrams, etc.). Used via CLI: py setup_coderef_dirs.py <project_path>

new_resources.name: test_setup_coderef_dirs.py
new_resources.description: Unit tests for setup_coderef_dirs.py with 100% test coverage
new_resources.notes: Tests all 8 directories creation, validation logic, and error handling. Part of coderef-core testing suite.

new_resources.name: scan.cjs
new_resources.description: CLI scanner implementation for CodeRef analysis (CommonJS)
new_resources.notes: Standalone CLI tool for running CodeRef scans. Uses TypeScript scanner engine (src/scanner/scanner.ts). Part of scan-cli workflow.

summary.findings_overview: The coderef-core package has 3 scripts that are NOT in the CSV. All 3 are production-ready and actively used (setup_coderef_dirs.py has 100% test coverage). These are critical scripts for the CodeRef scanning workflow.
summary.impact: Missing these 3 scripts from the CSV means the Resources page cannot display setup/scanner utilities from coderef-core. Users won't discover the Phase 0 setup script or CLI scanner.

notes: Scope: coderef-core package ONLY (NOT full dashboard project)
Dashboard agent will handle the rest of coderef-dashboard project
All 3 scripts are Python (.py) or CommonJS (.cjs) - no TypeScript scripts
No Tools, Commands, Validators, or Schemas found in coderef-core scope
src/ directory contains TypeScript modules (scanner engine, file generation, etc.) but NOT slash commands or MCP tools
